document_data.caption: [[Jerome Diloontier]] makes perfume.
document_data.name: Perfume
document_data.mainbody:
A specialist perfume shop, the [[House of Pride]], existed within [[Waterdeep]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
* [[Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue (in-universe)|Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue]] sold a variety of [[Westgate]]-made perfumes, and claimed they were the world's finest. They were named [[Jasmine Night]], [[Flowers (perfume)|Flowers]], [[Mountain Breeze]], [[Mystra's Spell]], [[Red Rose]], [[Ocean Mist]], [[Night Spice]], [[Lliira's Joy]], [[Breath of Spring]], and finally, [[Sune's Fire]].
* [[A Kiss Across the Table]] in [[Mosstone]] sold a wide variety of goods like perfumes, ''[[Philter of love|philters of love]]'', and high-heel lace-up bright-red [[boots]].
* [[Jerome Diloontier]], a skilled perfumer that worked in [[Waterdeep]].{{Cite dragon/259/Rogues Gallery: Dream Spheres|63}}
* [[Nottle]], a shifty and opportunistic [[rogue]] and peddler from the ruins of [[Myth Drannor]] carved various and often random items, including perfume.
* [[Peraegh Omliskur]], a seller of fragrances, facepaints, nailbrights, and fanciful [[silk]]s from [[Cormyr]] who traded in the most cutting edge stock popular among young nobility, to the older generation of Cormyrean ladies' disdain.
* [[Quintessa]], a merchant of exotic perfumes.
* The [[Flame of Love Lutery]] in [[Jester's Green]] sold various perfumed and scented items for romantic purposes.
document_data.Description:
In the [[Realms]], "scent" came to mean general pleasant-smelling substances, while "perfume" came to mean stronger, longer-lasting substances that could be worn, applied to items, or misted across an area.

Perfume was stored in [[vial]]s and bottles that were sometimes covered with [[sealing wax]]. Scents were made from a wide variety of natural and processed materials, such as [[vegetable]] [[oil]]s, plant sap and [[resin]], [[herb]]s, [[spice]]s, animal fluids and organs, and minerals.
document_data.Applications:
Some perfumes had [[magic]]al qualities, and sprinkling perfume was required for casting the air variation of ''[[protection from the elements]]''. Perfume was even used to repulse [[vampire]]s.

[[Beeswax]] could be purified of its [[honey]] smell and be given new scents.

Notable Perfumes.Mundane Perfumes:
[[File:Dwarven Cologne.png|thumb|''A bottle of dwarven scent.'']]

* [[Avarine]], an expensive perfume from [[Netheril]].
* [[Bluestars]], an expensive concoction that smelled of fresh before-storm winds.{{Cite web/Candlekeep Forum/Questions for Ed Greenwood (2007)/06-03 - Perfumes and Scents}}
* [[Darkdew]], a powerful aphrodisiac perfume.
* [[Felsul flower oil]], a perfume formed from petals of the [[felsul]] tree, that made the wearer more charismatic.
* [[Frankincense]], a sweet-smelling mundane perfume used by [[Bedine]] women.
* [[Harlyr]], a cheap [[rose]]-smelling perfume that stank of charred [[goldflow]] when applied to  [[goblinoid]] skin.
* [[Jasmine dust]], an expensive perfume from Kara-Tur.
* [[Jassal]], an extremely expensive [[cherry]]-like perfume that had peculiar reactions with flesh.
* [[Sunrise (perfume)|Sunrise]], an expensive perfume that left a [[mint]]y, citrusy smell.
* [[Tanlarl]], a reasonably expensive perfume that could create an irresistible allure for females.
* Other common scents included [[cinnamon]], [[patchouli]], [[sandalwood]], [[myrrh]], [[rose]], [[lily of the valley]], [[violet]], [[peach]], [[apple]], [[vanilla]], and [[pine]].
Notable Perfumes.Magical Perfumes:
* ''[[Perfume of bewitching]]'', a [[wondrous item|wondrous]] perfume that made the wearer fascinating.
* ''[[Silver spark]]'', a luminescent, musky perfume-[[poison]] that could greatly sicken or kill someone who breathed in the rich scent.
* ''[[Starella's aphrodisiac]]'', a magical perfume that could [[charm]] those of the opposite sex if they were a similar race.

document_data.History: In the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], a fad emerged among the wealthy and nobility of [[Sembia]] known as "tomb-scents." These were rare perfumes, for whom the knowledge of how to create was lost to time and thus were obtained from plundering the tombs of fallen realms, such as Netheril.

Notable Users of Perfumes.Individuals:
* [[Anorrweyn Evensong]] of [[Myth Drannor]] wore a delicate scent of [[gardenias]].
* [[Elena]], one of the victims of the [[Weeping War]], wore [[jasmine (plant)|jasmine]] perfume, as the scent emanated from the [[ghost]]ly form after death.
* [[Ulia Mannicci]], the First Lady of [[Sumbria]], wife of Price [[Cappa Mannicci]], ''circa'' [[1217 DR]].
* The [[Grand Caliph]] of [[Zakhara]] possessed special perfumes. One such example produced in [[1372 DR]] was kept in a cut [[ruby]] bottle, sealed in [[wax]] and stamped with his device, and valued at 4,000 gp in [[1479 DR]].
Notable Users of Perfumes.Intelligent Creatures & Races:
* Some [[cloud giant]]s collected rare perfumes, stored within crystal vials with [[silver]] lids, in order to display their extravagance.
* Some male [[dwarves]] of the Realms were known to perfume their beards, as did the females.
* Among the many luxuries they strove for, [[noble djinn]] often sought to have the richest of perfumes.
* In the land of Zakhara, [[great ghul]]s were fond of all forms of perfume and would use them to mask their unpleasant odor.
Notable Users of Perfumes.Religions: * Cultists of [[living idol]]s of [[elemental air]] were known to sacrifice exotic perfumes to them.
